beans.description:
This adaptor does the following...
* reads input file line by line, with time intervals between every line * writes to console
It is designed to illustrate the basic structure of a throttling read connector, that allows to 'throttle' reading of input data (in this case from a file, but any IReadConnector could be wrapped in a ThrottlingReadConnector with the same effect).
Run it like this...
java org.openadaptor.spring.SpringAdaptor -config throttling-file.xml
You need the following in your classpath
lib lib/openadaptor.jar lib/openadaptor-spring.jar lib/openadaptor-depends.jar

bean.description: This creates the simple pipeline ThrottlingReader -> Writer
This read connector reads lines from a file.
Read connector that adds 'throttling' to the connector it wraps. It reads 2 lines of input file, then pauses for 3 seconds, reads 2 lines etc.
This writer writes data to the console.
